description.narrative: IntraHealth is leading a five-year USAID-funded program to build the capacity of Ugandan institutions to plan for, develop, and strengthen the management of their health care workforce. Building on the success of the IntraHealth-led Capacity Project, IntraHealth is working with the Ministry of Health, other line ministries, and professional councils and will also be collaborating with Makerere University School of Public Health, Mbarara University, Gulu University, and the Uganda Management Institute. Launched in 2009, the initiative focuses on: 1) Enhancing capacity for human resources for health (HRH) policy and planning 2) Strengthening HRH systems for improved health care quality 3) Improving health workforce management practices.

title.narrative: Performance evaluation of USAID/Uganda capacity program
Performance evaluation of USAID/Uganda capacity program
